thread.title: Surprise Guest Crashes Beyonce and Jay Z’s Date Night
thread.title_full: Surprise Guest Crashes Beyonce and Jay Z’s Date Night

author: Jason Pham
title: Surprise Guest Crashes Beyonce and Jay Z’s Date Night
text:
February 26, 2017 by Jason Pham 0 Shares Advertisement 
Music's royal couple stepped out last night for a party celebrating the Oscar-nominated film Lion . 
But while Beyonce and Jay Z were schmoozing with other celebs, there was a surprise guest who happened to be from Jay Z's past. 
The star-studded gala, hosted by the The Weinstein Company, was held at the Montage in Beverly Hills. Bey and Jay Z made their grand entrance just as Cynthia Erivo, Corbin Bleu, and Chris Jackson were finishing up a three-song set from the studio's film adaptation of the musical In the Heights . A post shared by marcmalkin (@marcmalkin) on Feb 25, 2017 at 11:05pm PST 
Naturally, Queen Bey and her hubby aren't going to want to miss out on anything. So Weinstein Company boss Harvey Weinstein requested the first five minutes of the performance be repeated just for the pair. 
While the trio belted out musical numbers, the couple jived in their seats and gave a standing ovation when the performance was finished. A post shared by marcmalkin (@marcmalkin) on Feb 25, 2017 at 11:05pm PST 
Beyonce and her recently revealed baby bump with twins looked radiant in body-hugging green gown and jeweled bracelets. Jay Z dressed in all black with a blinding diamond ring on his left hand. 
The A-list couple noshed on desserts, including a vanilla caramel budino and chocolate cake while sipping champagne — just water for Beyonce. The Carters were also spotted holding hands, with Jay Z rubbing his wife's back. A post shared by Ramin Setoodeh (@raminsetoodeh) on Feb 25, 2017 at 11:53pm PST 
Naturally, the party's guests gravitated towards the couple. Cynthia was seen shaking hands with the "Formation" singer while designers Zac Posen and Georgina Chapman also chatted up the star. 
Other attendees included Lion stars Nicole Kidman, Dev Patel, and Sunny Paware, as well as Glee actor Matthew Morrison and shoe designer Christian Louboutin. A post shared by Ramin Setoodeh (@raminsetoodeh) on Feb 25, 2017 at 11:28pm PST 
While the Carters were flocked to by celebs, there was a party attendee we're sure the "Hold Up" would rather wasn't in her proximity. 
That happened to be fashion designer Rachel Roy, Jay Z's alleged mistress who has been speculated to have partly inspired Beyonce's Lemonade . A post shared by Norah Lawlor (@lawlormedia) on Feb 26, 2017 at 12:41am PST 
Beyonce and Jay Z stayed at the party for roughly 25 minutes before leaving through a doorway next to the stage. No word yet on if Bey locked eyes with Rachel. But maybe it's good for the designer that the singer left early.
